results.title: Pre set tooling and automatic control
results.creator_credit: Peter Riding, Humphrey Barron and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Approaching Automation”.
Adapted metal cutting machines can greatly improve quality control, reduce scrap, decrease operator fatigue, and generally allow labour to be used more efficiently. Dealing with the use of a capstan lathe it is proposed that a job should be able to be rest before t becomes necessary. Problems of suing hie method are discussed and types pf controls available for particular jobs including fluid logic and pneumatic circuitry.

results.title: Pre history of man: on the threshold of consciousness
results.brief_description: An illustration of Pavlov’s theories of how human skills and instincts may have developed from his ape-like ancestors. The responses of monkeys and their ability to learn and to work out problems are demonstrated, with their implications about human behaviour. Research materials used in this film were provided by the academic Ivan Pavlov and Professors Voronin, Gerasimor, Ladygina-Kots, Roginsky, Semyonov, Tikh and Yakimov.

results.title: Pre-occupied
results.creator_credit: Solrun Hoaas, Trish Carney and Victorian Women's Film Unit
results.brief_description: Using the device of a film within a film, “Pre-occupied” explores the decision to have or not to have children, while at the same time examining the roles and responsibilities of the documentary filmmaker. Cast includes: Victoria Arthur, Sue Jones, Samuel Krum, Rebecca Botelor, Greg Carroll, Carolyn Howard, Howard Stanley and others.

results.title: Pre-Approach
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Salesmanship”.
The methods employed by a salesman of industrial lubricants in making a very difficult sale is illustrated. The film emphasizes the need to acquire the pertinent information about a perspective client before the sales interview and adjusting the sales plan to suit the ideas and personality of the customer.

results.title: Prayers of a mother
results.material_description: Multi channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: A video installation that centres around a mother’s prayers for her children. Her hopes and concern for her family are expressed through edited sequences of her children’s faces contrasted by a single image of her hands holding a prayer book and rosary.

results.title: Prairie provinces of Canada
results.brief_description: A study of Manitoba, Alberta, and Saskatchewan, provinces which depend mainly on grain production for their prosperity, although mining and fur-farming are also important aspects of their economy. The processes involved in grain production, from planting to milling, are traced in detail.

results.title: Practice makes perfect drivers
results.brief_description: Lists a number of ways in which a motorist may improve his driving techniques; driving on rough roads and under bad weather conditions; passing other vehicles on the road; control of a vehicle in a skid, when dlipping under icy conditions and after a blowout; recommended techniques for driving at dusk and under night conditions.

results.title: Practical TV alignment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Television”.
Explains how to use television alignment equipment to obtain the visual response curve of a receiver on the oscilloscope screen. Practical demonstrations are used to show when a receiver is in need of alignment and to show the use of various types of equipment in testing alignment. The series is designed for screening to students studying television principles and servicing and is correlated with the McGraw text-book “Basic Television” by Bernard Croft.
